subject: p16360107
Findings: Portable AP view of the chest demonstrates low lung volumes. A moderate-to-large loculated right pleural effusion is longstanding, but appears increased in size from prior exam. Moderate loculated left pleural effusion is unchanged from prior. Bibasilar opacities are noted. There is prominence of the right mediastinum, suggestive of vascular congestion. Aortic arch calcifications are noted. Heart size is top normal. Mild pulmonary edema is present. Sternotomy wires are noted. Multiple surgical clips project over left cardiac border.
Impression: Moderate-to-large loculated right pleural effusion appears increased in size from prior exam. Moderate left pleural effusion is unchanged. Bibasilar opacities likely represent atelectasis or infection in the appropriate clinical setting. Mild pulmonary edema.
